A.title: Multiple Choice Questions
A.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each from the given options

B.title: Short-Answer Questions
B.instructions: Attempt any Ten part questions in all. All questions carry equal marks. (i.e. 4 marks of each part).

questions.question:
Evaluate any one of the following:
a) limₓ→₁ (1/x - 1)
b) limₓ→ₑ (ln x - 1)/(x - e)

Find the values of m and n, so that given function f continuous at x = 3
f(x) = { mx/n if x < 3; -2x + 9 if x > 3 }
If y = √(tan x + √(tan x + √(tan x + ... + ∞)), prove that (2y - 1)dy/dx = sec²x
Find dy/dx ln(cosh⁻¹x) + sinh⁻¹y = C OR Differentiate y = cos²x w.r.t sin²x
Show that f(x) = tan²x is decreasing at x = 3π/4

A particle moves so that its position as a function of time is given by r⃗(t) = sin t + cos t + tk. Write expressions for its:
a) Velocity b) acceleration as function of time

Compute the definite integrals by using basic properties.
∫[-π/2 to π/2] sin²x cos²x dx

Find the area, above the x-axis under the following curve, between the given ordinates.
y = 6sin²x, x = 0, x = π/3
The line segment joining P(-8,10) and Q(6,-4) is cut by x and y axes at A and B respectively. Find the ratios in which A and B divide PQ
The x-intercept of a line is the reciprocal of its y-intercept and line passes through (2,-1). Find its equation
Find the equation of the circle passing through (-3,-4) and is concentric with the circle whose equation is x² + y² - 6x + 8y - 24 = 0
The volume of the cone is given by formula V = ⅓πr²h. Differentiate V with respect to their independent variables
Find the equation of parabola whose focus is at (-4,3) and equation of directrix is y = 6
Find the condition when line y = √5x + c is tangent to the ellipse 4x² + 9y² = 36
Find the orthogonal trajectory of the curve y = ax²

C.title: Detailed Answer Questions
C.instructions: Answer any FIVE questions from this section. Question No. 3 is compulsory. All questions carry equal marks.

questions.question:
Evaluate any two of the following:
a) ∫[-π/2 to π/2] dx
b) ∫ e²ˣ sin 2x dx
c) ∫[3 to 2√3] x²dx/√(x²+4)
d) ∫ dx/((x-3)(x²+1))
Find the first four terms of the Taylor's series of f(x) = ln(1 + x) at b = 2

If A(2,5), B(3,7) and C(0,8) are the vertices of a triangle then find the equation of:
a) median through A
b) right bisector of side AC

Find the equation of tangent(s) to the circle x² + y² = 25 which is:
a) parallel to 3x + 4y + 1 = 0
b) perpendicular to 3x + 4y + 1 = 0

Find Centre, foci, eccentricity, length of latus rectum and vertices of hyperbola:
16y² + 9x² + 36x + 64y = 116 = 0
Solve the differential equation (2x + y + 1)dx + (2x + y - 1)dy = 0
If u = tan⁻¹((x³ + y³)/(x - y)) then prove that x(∂u/∂x) + y(∂u/∂y) = sin 2u
Using any numerical method for finding roots of the equation up to 2 decimal places of x³ - 2x - 5 = 0. [2, 3]
